I think chaos and randomness is part of life. Wanting to standardize everything to minimize chaos can be counterproductive in the long run. Everything is in a state of flux, and trying to make things predictable won't do any good. A much better approach would be to constantly adapt ourselves to the stream of life. If there's no standard, we can always invent a new standard, as all standards are ultimately subjective. And this constant inventiveness is much better than stasis. What doesn't flow stagnates, and becomes obsolete pretty fast. 

I'm against any kind of monopoly in the instant messaging field.
